p: Analysis of neutrophils sampled 4 weeks after neutrophil engraftment and beyond (Figure S1) showed that this effect was transient. Neutrophil chemotaxis was not significantly different from those of the untreated controls (Figures 4A,B). Thus, our data implies that there might be a window of increased risk of infection for the transplant recipients after engraftment (30 days in average) in which neutrophil numbers are high, but they might still have functional limitations (Table 1).
